meta.description: Context Sensitive Help for the table "tx_partner_relationships"

languageKey.label: Type of the relationship
The type defines exactly what kind of relationship the two partners have. This list can be defined by your administrator.
Primary Partner of the relationship

Chose the primary partner for this relationship. Explanation: Primary vs. Secondary partner A relationship always consists of exactly two partners. One is the primary partner, the other is the secondary partner. The type of a relationship defines what kind of relationships the two partners have. Let's say, for instance, that one partner is the member of the other, like a member of a club. Well in this case, the relationship type you want to have is 'has member'. You can see already from the formulation of the type that there is a 'direction' to the relationship. Club Y 'has member' Mr. Miller and not the other way round. So Club Y is the primary partner and Mr. Miller is the secondary partner.
Secondary Partner of the relationship

Chose the primary partner for this relationship. Explanation: Primary vs. Secondary partner A relationship always consists of exactly two partners. One is the primary partner, the other is the secondary partner. The type of a relationship defines what kind of relationships the two partners have. Let's say, for instance, that one partner is the member of the other, like a member of a club. Well in this case, the relationship type you want to have is 'has member'. You can see already from the formulation of the type that there is a 'direction' to the relationship. Club Y 'has member' Mr. Miller and not the other way round. So Club Y is the primary partner and Mr. Miller is the secondary partner.
Status of the relationship
Describes the current status of the relationship. The list of possible status can be defined by your administrator. Possible values could be 'Active', 'Passive' or 'To be archived'.
Established Date of the relationship
This is the date when the relationship has been established. For the type 'Has Wife' for instance, this would be the date of marriage.
Lapsed Date of the relationship
This is the date when the relationship has ceased to exist. For the type 'Has Member' for instance, this would be the date when the member left the club.
Lapsed Reason of the relationship
Could be used for instance to enter the reason why a member left a club.
